page.title: 14FARMING 1
page.content: The main animals around here are dairy,beef cattle and horses.There is a fair amount of permanent pasture for grazing and also providing hay for winter feed.These pastures are usually situated near rivers and streams.They are not suitable for arable crop,being too wet for cultivations.The labour force on farms has decreased over the years because of a greater use of machinery and an increase in farm wages.The only time extra labour is used is in the summer and autumn for harvest work and potatoe picking.Machinery is continually being designed to give greater output and increased efficiency.The aim of the farmer is to produce high yiuelds at low costs. By Simon Kennedy.
